intro: Dorstenia cayapia subsp. cayapia, commonly known as the Cayapia spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spiraled leaves that curl tightly around the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
